CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1953, pg. 15 reads: "Denied Skating - Mrs. Edna Boetz, secretary of the Lexington Amusement Company and also of the "Lexington Roller Skating Club," which seven plaintiff attorneys have labelled a "gimmick" designed to exclude Negroes, prepares to enter the Common Pleas courtroom presided over by Judge Henry X. O'Brien, shortly before hearings resumed as members of the local NAACP seek a preliminary injunction against the rink - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Edna Boetz, secretary for the Lexington Roller Skating Club, wearing dark coat with light colored fur collar, walking in corridor of the Allegheny County Courthouse for hearing against the Lexington Amusement Company
